alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 8:42PM EDT until April 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR SUSSEX COUNTY... At 841 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Henlopen Acres to near Millville to near Gumboro, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Millsboro, Laurel, Lewes, Milton, Selbyville, Delmar, Dagsboro, Millville, Ellendale, Henlopen Acres, Gumboro, Cape Henlopen State Park, Sycamore, Long Neck, Ocean View, Frankford, South Bethany and Dewey Beach. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern Delaware. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
